items.question: How long does it take to develop a web project?
items.answer: Development time varies depending on the complexity of the project. A basic website can be ready in 1 week, while more complex applications may require up to 1 month or more.

items.question: How does the work process function?
items.answer: Our process includes: initial consultation, detailed proposal, UI/UX design, development, quality testing, launch, and post-launch support. We maintain constant communication throughout the project.

items.question: Do you offer maintenance after launch?
items.answer: Yes, we offer maintenance plans and continuous support to ensure your site or application functions optimally and securely after launch.

challenge.title: Challenge
challenge.defaultContent: Create an innovative solution that solves real user problems, implementing best practices in development and UX/UI design.

solution.title: Solution
solution.defaultContent: Development of a modern application using cutting-edge technologies, focusing on user experience and system scalability.

results.title: Results
results.defaultContent: Successful implementation that exceeded client expectations, significantly improving the user experience and optimizing key business processes.

peakyBlinders.title: Peaky Blinders
peakyBlinders.description: Interactive platform developed by EMB for the official presentation of the Peaky Blinders series. Includes detailed character biographies, interactive timelines, and exclusive content for fans. The site incorporates visual elements inspired by the aesthetics of the era, with subtle animations that enhance the user experience without compromising performance.
peakyBlinders.challenge: Create an immersive experience that captured the essence of the series while maintaining high performance on all devices.
peakyBlinders.solution: EMB implemented an optimized React architecture with lazy loading and a user interface that reflects the aesthetics of the era, maintaining minimal loading times and a smooth experience on mobile and desktop devices.

dunkinDonuts.title: Dunkin Donuts
dunkinDonuts.description: Complete redesign of the Dunkin Donuts corporate website carried out by EMB, with a focus on improving user experience and optimizing conversions. The platform includes an online ordering system, store location via geolocation, and a customized administration panel to manage products, promotions, and real-time sales analysis.
dunkinDonuts.challenge: Modernize the brand's digital presence while implementing an efficient and scalable ordering system that could handle traffic spikes.
dunkinDonuts.solution: EMB developed a Next.js architecture with SSR to optimize SEO and performance, integrated secure payment gateways, and designed an intuitive interface that reflects the brand's personality while facilitating conversion.

learnIA.title: Learn AI
learnIA.description: Innovative educational platform developed by EMB that uses artificial intelligence to personalize the learning experience. The system analyzes each student's progress and learning style to adapt content, exercises, and assessments. Includes real-time collaboration tools, gamification system, and detailed performance analysis for students and educators.
learnIA.challenge: Develop an educational platform that used AI to personalize learning while maintaining high scalability and ease of use for students and teachers.
learnIA.solution: EMB implemented a hybrid system with React on the frontend and PHP on the backend for AI data processing, creating adaptive learning algorithms and an intuitive interface that facilitates both teaching and learning.

iphone.title: Apple iPhone 3D Animated Website
iphone.description: Premium recreation of the iPhone 15 Pro website developed by EMB, which elevates the user experience through advanced GSAP animations and immersive 3D effects with Three.js. The site presents the product with smooth transitions, interactive 3D visualizations of the device, and a visual narrative that highlights the features of the product in an elegant and attractive way.
iphone.challenge: Recreate the premium Apple experience with smooth animations and detailed 3D models without compromising performance on mid and low-end devices.
iphone.solution: EMB used Next.js with TypeScript for a solid foundation, implemented Three.js for optimized 3D rendering with adaptive level of detail, and used GSAP for smooth animations with high resource efficiency.
